docs.snippet: A bizarre tale of international kidnapping has resulted in a significant court decision here against illegal searches and seizures by United States agents in foreign lands.
docs.lead_paragraph: A bizarre tale of international kidnapping has resulted in a significant court decision here against illegal searches and seizures by United States agents in foreign lands.

headline.main: COURT EDICT CURBS U.S. ROLE ABROAD; Consultations Being Held Wiretaps' Use Cited Request Dismissed Order on Illegal Searchers Stirred by Drug Dealer Allegedly Kidnapped

docs.snippet: Q. I would like to address a question to both Presidents. About the issues you discussed today. Was there a discussion of American access to the recently discovered oil deposits in southern Mexico, and could you give us an estimate of the size of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. I would like to address a question to both Presidents. About the issues you discussed today. Was there a discussion of American access to the recently discovered oil deposits in southern Mexico, and could you give us an estimate of the size of those deposits?
docs.abstract: Pres Ford and Mex Pres Echeverria agree to set up 'new revitalized' joint comm to study illegal immigration of Mexican workers to US (M)

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Oct. 24--Under the crush of a rapidly increasing urban population and a strong government bias in favor of industrial growth, Latin America is threatened with losing its status as a net exporter of food in coming years.
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Oct. 24--Under the crush of a rapidly increasing urban population and a strong government bias in favor of industrial growth, Latin America is threatened with losing its status as a net exporter of food in coming years.
docs.abstract: another in series of articles on world food situation holds that Latin Amer is threatened with losing status as net food exporter in near future due to rapidly rising urban population and strong govt bias in favor of industrial growth; cites FAO studies indicating that as many as 1/2 of 280-million Latin Amers live on moderately or seriously deficient diets; notes that despite its plight, Latin Amer has maintained traditionally favorable trade balance in agr on basis of strong exports from key countries; comments on deterioration in agr sector and on population migration to urban areas; assesses situation in several countries (L)

headline.main: Latin America's Role of Food Exporter Is Threatened; Crisis 'No Longer Regional' Prices Depressed

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELLSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The Organization of American States opens a five-day ministerial meeting here tomorrow to decide whether to end its decade-old economic and political isolation of Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Organization of American States opens a five-day ministerial meeting here tomorrow to decide whether to end its decade-old economic and political isolation of Cuba.
docs.abstract: OAS to meet on Nov 8 to decide whether to end econ and pol isolation of Cuba; Mex Emilio O Rabasa and Costa Rican Gonzalo Facio Segreda optimistic that necessary 14 votes will be obtained to end sanctions; Facio Segreda warns if effort to lift blockade fails, several more nations would soon rescind sanctions on their own, which would be to further detriment of inter-Amer system; advocates to end isolation try to persuade undecided delegates to vote in favor of lifting econ and pol sanctions as they reach Quito, Ecuador; Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay strongly oppose ending sanctions; Chilean delegation promises to produce similar evidence in effort to maintain quarantine against Cuba; turnabout in attitude toward Havana Govt is partly result of evaporation of fears that Cubans are subversive threat to other nations in hemisphere; Deputy Sec Robert S Ingersoll is US delegate to OAS; Chilean delegates have invited Juana Castro, sister of Cuban Premier Castro and former Cuban Pres Carlos Prio, Miami-based exiles; policemen and army troops tighten security as J Castro, Prio and other exiles are placed under police custody; bomb explodes at Bolivian Embassy; 1 injury reptd; bomb explodes at Center for Brazilian Studies, supported by Brazilian Embassy; minor damage reptd (M)

headline.main: O.A.S. Meets in Ecuador Today On Issue of Cuban Sanctions; 3 Strongly Opposed

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Lifting of the economic and political sanctions against Cuba by the Organization of American States at its current session here could ease the way to a reconciliation between Washington and Havana, diplomatic sources familiar with the position of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lifting of the economic and political sanctions against Cuba by the Organization of American States at its current session here could ease the way to a reconciliation between Washington and Havana, diplomatic sources familiar with the position of the United States delegation said.
docs.abstract: diplomatic sources rept that lifting of econ and pol sanctions against Cuba by OAS could ease way to reconciliation between US and Havana; caution that formal end to blockade of Cuba would not necessarily mean that US would move toward reestablishing diplomatic and econ ties with Govt of Premier Fidel Castro; note if motion to lift sanctions failed to gather necessary 2/3s majority, rapprochement between US and Cuba could be delayed; depict US as eager to avoid further polarizing OAS members over Cuban issue; say final decision by Amer delegation, led by Under Sec of Sate Robert S Ingersoll, would be made only after close and constant consultations with Sec State Kissinger; sanctions promoted by US noted (M)

headline.main: BOYCOTT OF CUBA DEBATED BY O.A.S.; Issue of Consultations Sanctions Promoted by U.S. Proposal to Lift Sanctions Is Strongly Opposed by Some Latin Countries

byline.original: Special to the New York TimesBy JONATHAN KANDELL

docs.snippet: Acccording to a prominent Orthodox rabbi, nothing is so revolting to the third-generation American Jew as the sight of his Hasidic brethren on the street. With their Yiddish accents and East European clothing, the story goes, they remind him of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Acccording to a prominent Orthodox rabbi, nothing is so revolting to the third-generation American Jew as the sight of his Hasidic brethren on the street. With their Yiddish accents and East European clothing, the story goes, they remind him of something he had a nose job to forget.
docs.abstract: Ray Schultz article on Lubavitcher movement of Hasidic Jews, led by Rabbi Menachem M Schneerson; describes their proselytizing on NYC sts, their founding in 18th century, their religious, soc and educational traditions; describes Chabbad houses, relief centers for students; illus of Lubavitchers (L)

headline.main: The call of the ghetto; The Lubavitchers believe it takes only a little stoking to ignite the spark of religion in every Jew Lubavitchers ' I dabbled in Zen Buddhism and L.S.D. ... then someone said to me, "Why not give your own religion a chance?"'

docs.snippet: Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a formal end of the blockade of Cuba scrambled today to come up with a resolution acceptable to two-thirds of the members of the Organization of American States.
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a formal end of the blockade of Cuba scrambled today to come up with a resolution acceptable to two-thirds of the members of the Organization of American States.
docs.abstract: Latin-Amer foreign mins advocating formal end of blockade of Cuba attempt to come up with resolution, acceptable to 2/3s of OAS members, Quito, Ecuador, meeting; 14 votes necessary to remove econ and pol sanctions imposed by OAS on Cuba because of her alleged attempts to interfere in internatl affairs of other nations; countries considered in favor of repeal of econ sanctions are Argentina, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, El Salvador, Honduras, Mex, Panama, Peru, Dominican Repub, Trinidad and Tobago and Venezuela; attention focuses on votes of Guatemala, Bolivia and Haiti, whose delegates appear to be wavering; anti-Castro nations, such as Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay, noted; Costa Rican Foreign Min Gonzalo Facio suggests tacit understanding to give countries freedom to end Cuban blockade, even if final agreement does not explicitly state it (M)

headline.main: GUBA SUPPORTERS SEEK O.A.S. VOTES; Proposal to Lift Sanctions Runs Into Difficultiess
